p: Evolving in the Old World, murines are a comparatively recent introduction into the New World, most probably via the Bering land isthmus some 20â€“30 million years ago. Whilst other rodents have declined in number, murine rodents have thrived, especially in peri-urban areas. This means that, although species diversity has become less with fewer genera represented, those remaining have multiplied many times over. It is among species of the family Muridae that reservoir hosts of arenaviruses and hantaviruses are to be found in South America.
